constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 49 (Tuesday, March 16, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. RADEWAGEN:
H.R. 1941.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.
[Page H1414]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

sponsors.fullName: Del. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]

title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to waive certain naturalization requirements for United States nationals, and for other purposes.
